Petition subject: Resources

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:28548189

Date of creation: 1760

Petition location: [London, England?]

Selected signatures:

  1. Reuben Cognehew

Total signatures: 1

Males of color signatures: 1

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: a Mohegan Indian of the Tribe commonly known by the name of the South Shore Indians in behalf of himself and the rest of the said Tribe of Indians, [males of color]

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Native American tribe: Mashpee

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.

Additional archivist notes: South Sea, proprietors, Cape Cod, Quichatapet, Quichatasset, Monament, deeds, patent, lands, 1666, Maunamoquest, Maunamoqeset, Maunamoyeset, Ashimuit Pond, Mauqutchaquit Pond, Kaukoratchimissuck, English, Spectacle Pond, Kauskatit, Nakonkomisit, Koctuit River, harbor, Koctuit Bay, Maunamoyeset, Waykoit, boundaries, encroachments, Mashpee River, meadows, necks, creeks, timber, wood, hunting, fowling, fishing, fisheries, redress, applications, petitioning, General Court, agents, footsteps of your Majesty's sacred throne, royal patronage and protection, journey, Rhode Island, England, West Indies, wicked design, shipwreck, Coast of Hispaniola, ships of war, Jamaica, merchant ship, Wamponkanunis, Askunokan, William Ulease, Workees, Compoknet, 1672, Andrew Oliver, Lord Commissioners for Trade and Plantations, Indian guardians, William Sharpe, debts, sale, [additional documents in volumes, see pages 144-152 and v.303, pages 100-102a, including 144-145, order of Royal Council on petition of Mohegan or South Shore Indians, August 12, 1760; 149-150, copy of Indian deed under which South Shore Indians claim their possessions, November 20, 1666; 152, order of council for a hearing on grievances complained by Mashpee Indians, December 20, 1760]

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Massachusetts Archives volume 33, pages 146-149
